nodes.bodyText:
I think we should probably replace all these sections with a comment similar to the root README.md
For details on contributing to this repository, see the [contributing guide])(https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ helps developers create their performance tests for their APIs.
 ## Contributing
 
 If you would like to become an active contributor to this project please follow the instructions provided in [Microsoft

nodes.bodyText: Root readme includes more information than this line. Do you think it is better to refer the README contributing section?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ helps developers create their performance tests for their APIs.
 ## Contributing
 
 If you would like to become an active contributor to this project please follow the instructions provided in [Microsoft

nodes.bodyText:
Checked several readmes, it seems different sdk have different wording here. I would prefer to make minimum changes and ask team to make it standard.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/core/azure-core-amqp-experimental/README.md
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/storage/azure-storage-queue/README.md#contributing

 ## Contributing
 
 If you would like to become an active contributor to this project please follow the instructions provided in [Microsoft

nodes.bodyText: Honestly for each of the service level readme's I think it is better to link to the repo level contributing guide it is just a matter of whether we should ask the owners of these files to update them or if we should just do a sweep. Given this is very generic I suspect we should just do a sweep to update them.
